hanzi-su-wiki:
丸

Значения

Шарик; круглый. Пилюля; пуля; снаряд. Сч. слово

Мнемоника

  • Верхняя черта с продолжением вправо представляет обрыв. В центре — человек 人. То, что скатывается с обрыва, должно быть круглым.

  • "Я прогнул спину, и она стала круглой."

Варианты

𠁽

wán
ball; pellet; pill
мяч; пеллета; таблетка

丸丸RS
X		round, spherical, make round, circle, full, ships, castles
  • con.: harvesting: hand with a sickle → cutting with rounded motions; result: a full barn, independent subsistence for a long time
 円; 球; 満; 穫; 船 城; 埶 熟 塾 執

丸丸RSsmall round object, pellet, pill
  • nine 九 plus one 丶 makes the circle of the numbers round: 10 ends in 0 → round small object
 円; 球; 満; 穫; 船 城; 埶 熟 塾 執
purpleculture_info: Pictographic: A fist 九 holding a pebble 丶
purpleculture_examples:
定心丸 [ dìng xīn wán ]: tranquilizer; sth that sets one's mind at ease
摇头丸 [ yáo tóu wán ]: Ecstasy; MDMA
弹丸 [ dàn wán ]: pellet
药丸 [ yào wán ]: pill; Classifiers: 粒
睾丸 [ gāo wán ]: testicle
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿻ Overlaid
    • 九 [ jiǔ ] nine
    • 丶 [ diǎn ] dot
heisig_chinese_memo: A drop of medicine is usually all you need.  Taking nine pills will surely lead to bad effects.
heisig_story: We speak of "round numbers," or "rounding a number off," meaning to add an insignificant amount to bring it to the nearest 10. For instance, if you add just a wee bit, the tiniest drop, to nine, you end up with a round number.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: round, full (month), perfection, -ship, pills, make round, roll up, curl up, seduce, explain away
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: круглый, полный (месяц), совершенство, -ship, таблетки, делают круглые, закатать, свернуться, соблазнить, объяснить
koohiiStory1: Nine plus a drop rounds it off to ten!
koohiiStory2: Watch out for plump (#120). Here Heisig could have added a "t" and we would have had a much better keyword : rotund. Rotund is more specific than "round" which begs for confusion with circle (#1811). A dictionary search on "fat" or "round" doesn´t yield this kanji, but "rotund" does! Primitive suggestion: the Laughing Buddha is often depicted as a rotund, smiling bald man in robes with a largely exposed pot belly stomach (symbolizing plenitude).
jp_example_words:
日の丸(ひのまる): the Japanese flag
丸ごと(まるごと): in its entirety, whole, wholly
丸っきり(まるっきり): completely, perfectly, just as if
丸々(まるまる): completely
丸める(まるめる): to make round, to round off, to roll up, to curl up, to seduce, to cajole, to explain away
真ん丸い(まんまるい): perfectly circular
丸(まる): circle
丸い(まるい): round, circular, spherical
jp_readingExamples: 丸 (まる), 丸い (まる.い), 丸める (まる.める)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: What's something with nine sides? Just add a drop and you'll have something that's almost a circle.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: It's not quite a circle though. You just need to add a drop of liquid to the edges to smooth it out to become a full circle.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
Do you know about the adorable cat Maru? If not, you should check it out. May seem like a distraction, but if you come back knowing the reading for this kanji, then it's totally worth while.
When you think about a circle, think about Maru all rolled up in a little circle, being super adorable. Don't tell me it doesn't melt your heart just thinking about it.
Alternatively, you could also look at this kanji and think of Maru inside of a box, with his little tail sticking out of it. Whatever works best for you, just get yourself to "Maru."
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Obviously if you "don't know this reading" well enough, you should watch some more Maru videos. I'll understand... just make sure you come back someday, okay?
Ru_Meaning: round, full (month), perfection, -ship, pills, make round, roll up, curl up, seduce, explain away
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 九 (ここのつ、キュウ девять)

Kanshudo_mnemonic: nine (九) dots (丶) make a circle

heisig_comment: * As a primitive, this element takes the meaning of a fat man. Think of a grotesquely fat man whose paunch so covers the plate that he is always getting hit by the pitch. Hence a round baseball player becomes a fat man.

Original meaning 本义: Meaning small round object.

English senses 英语理解: small round object; pellet, pill

Usage example 用法举例: 丸子 wán zǐ (meatball)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 2492

Shuowen 说文解字: 圜傾側而轉者從反仄凡丸之屬皆從丸

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Component 丸 older 𠁽 x2007d from person 人 rén and descend 乁 yi (not- 凡 fán x51e1) and (not- 丮 jǐ). (name- person-round 丸𠁽 wán)

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
丸𠁽 meaning round. 𠁽 x2007d proper form of round 丸 wan. 凡 x51e1 regular form of sail 凡 fan. phonetic in 芄紈纨 丮 from 埶 亵褻 势勢 热熱 [执]埶 执執 𦏧孰熟 執𡘺𡙕

Heisig constituents: round, drop, nine, baseball
Heisig: We speak of "round numbers," or "rounding a number off," meaning to add an insignificant amount to bring it to the nearest 10. For instance, if you add just a wee bit, the tiniest drop, to nine, you end up with a round number.
* As a primitive, this element takes the meaning of a fat man. Think of a grotesquely fat man whose paunch so covers the plate that he is always getting hit by the pitch. Hence a round baseball player becomes a fat man.
Chinese: A drop of medicine is usually all you need. Taking nine pills will surely lead to bad effects.

丸字的基本解释

丸
wán
小而圆的东西：弹（d刵 ）丸。肉丸儿。
专指“药丸”：丸散膏丹。丸药。
量词，用于丸药：吃两丸儿。

丸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wán］
［《廣韻》胡官切，平桓，匣。］
(1)泛称小圆球形的物体。
(2)弹丸，弹子。
(3)古代竞技游戏用的一种球。
(4)古代杂技表演中的一种铃。参见“丸劍”。
(5)鸟卵。
(6)药丸。
(7)圆形物的量词。
(8)揉物使成圆形。
(9)犹专。

丸字的英文翻译

◎ 丸
bolus, pellet, pill

丸字的康熙字典解释

【子集上】【丶字部】　丸； 康熙笔画：3； 页码：页80第15
俗?字。

丸字的源字形

丸字的起名意思

小而圆的物体。

pill
Basic explanation of words
pill
wán
Small and round things: Bomb (d 刵) pill. Meatballs.
Specifically refers to "pills": Pills San Gao Dan. bolus.
Quantifier, used in pills: take two pills.
pill
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wán］
["Guangyun" Hu Guanqie, Pinghuan, Xie. ]
(1) It is generally called a small spherical object.
(2) Projectiles, marbles.
(3) A ball used in ancient competitive games.
(4) A kind of bell in ancient acrobatics performances. See "Maru Sword".
(5) Bird eggs.
(6) Pills.
(7) The quantifier of round objects.
(8) Knead the object into a round shape.
(9) Still special.
pill

Name meaning
Small and round objects.
丸
会意字。篆书之形与仄相反。仄指有角不平;丸指无角,圆的。本义是指小而圆的东西。
①小而圆的东西:弹~|药~「泥~。②量词(用于药
丸):一~药|一次吃三~。

таблетка
Зная слово.
Форма письма печати противоположна чжэ.
Квадрат относится к рожкам и неровностям; таблетка относится к округлости без рогов.
Первоначальное значение относится к чему-то маленькому и круглому.
①Маленькие и круглые предметы: пули ~ | лекарства ~ "грязь ~. ②Количества (для таблеток): один ~ лекарство | ешьте три ~ за раз."

wán
I сущ./счётное слово
1) шарик; катышек; комок; пуля, ядро
泥丸 глиняный шарик
避丸 уклониться от пули, избежать пули
2) пилюля, облатка; таблетка (также счётное слово для лекарств, часто с 儿)
药丸儿 фарм. пилюля
一次吃三丸儿药 каждый прием принимать лекарства по 3 пилюли (таблетки)
3) яйцо (птицы)
凤之丸 яйцо феникса
4) округлый кусок; счётное слово для кусков туши; тушь
墨三百三十六丸 триста тридцать шесть кусков туши
松丸 тушь
墨三十六丸 36 кусков туши
5) пампушка, оладья (также 牢丸)
II гл.
смесить (скатать) в шарик
使婢丸药 приказать служанке скатать пилюли из лекарства
III в словообр.
яп. мару ― суффикс, завершающий название японских коммерческих судов
上海丸(wán) «Шанхай-мару»
IV собств.
Вань (фамилия)

丸

Значения

Шарик; круглый. Пилюля; пуля; снаряд. Сч. слово

Мнемоника

  • Верхняя черта с продолжением вправо представляет обрыв. В центре — человек 人. То, что скатывается с обрыва, должно быть круглым.

  • "Я прогнул спину, и она стала круглой."

Варианты

𠁽

Radicals: 九, 丶  (nine, drop)
Meaning Mnemonic
What's something with nine sides? Just add a drop and you'll have something that's almost a circle.
It's not quite a circle though. You just need to add a drop of liquid to the edges to smooth it out to become a full circle.
Reading Mnemonic
Do you know about the adorable cat Maru? If not, you should check it out. May seem like a distraction, but if you come back knowing the reading for this kanji, then it's totally worth while.
When you think about a circle, think about Maru all rolled up in a little circle, being super adorable. Don't tell me it doesn't melt your heart just thinking about it.
Alternatively, you could also look at this kanji and think of Maru inside of a box, with his little tail sticking out of it. Whatever works best for you, just get yourself to "Maru."
Obviously if you "don't know this reading" well enough, you should watch some more Maru videos. I'll understand... just make sure you come back someday, okay?
